revised_title: Triethylphosphine and Bisulfide of Carbon Reactions and Derivatives
tldr: The author, A. W. Hofmann, studied the reaction between triethylphosphine and bisulfide of carbon, resulting in a deep crimson-colored crystalline compound. This reaction can be used as a test for detecting traces of triethylphosphine. The new compound is insoluble in water and ether but soluble in alcohol. Its constitution is similar to the mineral compound, sulphocarbamate of ammonium.
